etymologies: late 19th century. From the name of Thomas Price, 19th-cent. U.S. metallurgist, who made the first analysis of the mineral + -ite

definitions: A mineral of the triclinic crystal system which consists of a hydrated calcium borate, Ca₄ B₁₀ O₁₉ ·7H₂ O, and typically occurs as white, earthy nodules and masses.
